Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGRAVED; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Graeco-Egyptian vase with appliques
Description: This piece in green faience belongs to the category of Graeco-Egyptian vases made in the 3rd and 2nd centuries BC. Of a typically Greek form, it has three appliques with the bearded head of Bes. The belly is divided into decorated registers, depicting palmettes, rosettes, birds and lotus.
